frontmatter.title: Simple yet functional phosphate-loop proteins
categories: Physics and Evolution of Biological Macromolecules
frontmatter.description: Abundant and essential motifs, such as phosphate-binding loops (P-loops), are presumed to be the seeds of modern enzymes. The Walker-A P-loop is absolutely essential in modern NTPase enzymes, in mediating binding, and transfer of the terminal phosphate groups of NTPs. However, NTPase function depends on many additional active-site residues placed throughout the proteinâ€™s scaffold.
